summary: This is an internal email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) dated August 18, 2019, discussing the upcoming week's schedule. It mentions the preparation of a 'nolle' (nolle prosequi) filing for Jeffrey Epstein following his death, the cancellation of a unit chiefs meeting, and routine trial and interview schedules.

persons.name: Chief, Criminal Division
persons.role: Chief of the Criminal Division, SDNY
persons.context: The sender of the email, discussing office schedules, the Epstein nolle filing, and cancelling a meeting.

events.title: Preparation of Epstein Nolle Filing
events.description: The email states the 'Epstein nolle should be ready on Monday morning' as they were waiting for the death certificate. This refers to the formal dropping of charges (nolle prosequi) following Jeffrey Epstein's death.

events.title: AUSA Interviews
events.description: Scheduled interviews conducted by Assistant United States Attorneys.

events.title: Other Last Day
events.description: Noted as 'Other Last Day!' on the schedule, context unclear.

events.title: Cancellation of Unit Chiefs Meeting
events.description: The Chief of the Criminal Division cancels the unit chiefs meeting due to people being unavailable, a tight Monday schedule, and no urgent need, rescheduling it for early September.

keyFacts: The document is an internal SDNY email from August 18, 2019, discussing office logistics.
It confirms the U.S. Attorney's Office was preparing to formally drop charges (file a nolle prosequi) against Jeffrey Epstein following his death, pending receipt of his death certificate.
It indicates the office was operating on a reduced 'end-of-August' schedule, with the Criminal Division Chief planning vacation.
The email addresses and names of the sender and recipients are redacted, indicated by placeholders like '(USANYS)'.
